A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Luke Skywalker's saga is the single greatest version of a mythological hero's journey in cinematic history. If you're entrusted with continuing his story\, you can't relegate him to a supporting role\, and you definitely can't abandon all of the character traits that define him\, let alone kill him off in vain. I know that Rian Johnson 'one time directed three really good episodes of Breaking Bad'\, but he clearly is not up to the task on writing the second act of Luke Skywalker. To be fair to him\, maybe no one is.
